edu.nyu.jetlite.tipster

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nyu.jetlite.tipster.Document
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Document
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Document provides a container for the text of a document and the annotations on a document.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Document()
      Creates a new document with no text or annotations.
      Document(java.io.File file)
      Creates a new document whose text is the contents of the file.
      Document(java.lang.String stg)
      Creates a new document with text stg and no annotations.

      annotateWithTag annotates document with Span of text between <tag> and </tag>.

      Returns the annotations beginning at character position start.

      Adds the char c to the end of the document.

      Adds the text stg to the end of the document.

      Returns the character at position posn in the document.

      Deletes the text and all annotations on a document, creating an empty document.

      Returns a Span covering the entire document.

      Returns a vector of all annotation types.
      int getNextAnnotationID()
      returns a unique integer for this Document, to be used in assigning an 'id' feature to an Annotation on this Document.
      int length()
      Returns the length of the document (in characters).
      java.lang.String normalizedText(Annotation ann)
      Returns the text subsumed by annotation ann, with leading and trailing whitespace removed, and other whitespace sequences replaced by a single blank.

      shrink the endpoint, using shrink, of all annotations of type type, to eliminate trailing whitespace.

      shrink the endpoint, using shrink, of all annotations in the document.

      Returns the text subsumed by span s.

      Returns the token annotation starting at position start, or null if no token starts at this position.

      Returns the token annotation ending at position end, or null if no token starts at this position.

      Returns a printable version of a document including all annotations.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Deletes the text and all annotations on a document, creating an empty document.

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String stg)
        Sets the text of a document. Warning: this should not be done if the document has annotations.

        Returns the entire text of the document.

        public void clearAnnotations()
        Removes all annotations on the document.

      • addAnnotation

        public Annotation addAnnotation(Annotation ann)
        Adds an annotation to the document.

      • removeAnnotation

        public void removeAnnotation(Annotation ann)
        Removes annotation ann from the document. Does nothing if ann is not an annotation on the document.

      • removeAnnotationsOfType

        public void removeAnnotationsOfType(java.lang.String type)
        removes all annotations of type 'type' from the document.

      • annotationsAt

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsAt(int start)
        Returns the annotations beginning at character position start. Returns null if there are no annotations starting at this position.

      • annotationsAt

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsAt(int start,
                                                  java.lang.String type)
        Returns the annotations of type type beginning at character position start. If there are no annotations of this type, returns null.

      • annotationsAt

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsAt(int start,
                                                  java.lang.String[] types)
        Returns the annotations which begin at character position start and whose type is in array types. If there are no such annotations, returns null.

      • annotationsEndingAt

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsEndingAt(int end)
        Returns the annotations ending at character position ending. Returns null if there are no annotations ending at this position.

      • annotationsEndingAt

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsEndingAt(int end,
                                                        java.lang.String type)
        Returns the annotations of type type ending at character position end. If there are no annotations of this type, returns null.

      • tokenAt

        public Token tokenAt(int start)
        Returns the token annotation starting at position start, or null if no token starts at this position.

      • tokenEndingAt

        public Token tokenEndingAt(int end)
        Returns the token annotation ending at position end, or null if no token starts at this position.

      • annotationsOfType

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsOfType(java.lang.String type)
        Returns a vector of all annotations of type type. Returns null if there are no annotations of this type.

      • annotationsOfType

        public java.util.Vector<Annotation> annotationsOfType(java.lang.String type,
                                                      Span span)
        Returns a vector of all annotations of type type whose span is contained within span. If span is null, all annotations of that type are returned. Returns null if there are no annotations starting at this position.

      • setCurrentHypothesis

        public void setCurrentHypothesis(java.lang.Object hypoId)
        sets the value of currentHypothesis. If currentHypothesis is non-null, a hypo feature with this value is added to every new annotation on this document.

      • setActiveHypotheses

        public void setActiveHypotheses(java.util.Set hypoIdSet)
        sets the value of activeHypotheses. If activeHypotheses is non-null, methods which retrieve annotations on a document only return those annotations whose hypo value is in activeHypotheses.

      • getAnnotationTypes

        public java.lang.String[] getAnnotationTypes()
        Returns a vector of all annotation types. Returns null if there are no annotation types. Warning: do not modify the returned vector. Doing so can affect the annotations stored on a document.

      • annotateWithTag

        public void annotateWithTag(java.lang.String tag,
                            int start,
                            int end)
        annotateWithTag annotates document with Span of text between <tag> and </tag>. Sets type of annotation to tag name.
        Parameters:
        tag - name of a tag to find a Span between tags
        start - where to start searching for a tag
        end - where to end searching for a tag

      • annotateWithTag

        public void annotateWithTag(java.lang.String tag)
        annotateWithTag annotates document with Span of text between <tag> and </tag>. Sets type of annotation to tag name.
        Parameters:
        tag - name of a tag to find a Span between tags

      • getNextAnnotationID

        public int getNextAnnotationID()
        returns a unique integer for this Document, to be used in assigning an 'id' feature to an Annotation on this Document.

      • stretch

        public void stretch(Annotation ann)
        extend the endpoint of Annotation ann to include the following whitespace past the current endpoint. However, do not extent the endpoint past the current starting point of any other annotation in order to avoid situations where annotations overlap but are not nested.

      • stretch

        public void stretch(java.lang.String type)
        extend the endpoint, using stretch, of all annotations of type type.

      • stretchAll

        public void stretchAll()
        extend the endpoint, using stretch, of all annotations in the document.

      • shrink

        public void shrink(Annotation ann)
        shrink the endpoint of Annotation code to remove any trailing whitespace.

      • shrink

        public void shrink(java.lang.String type)
        shrink the endpoint, using shrink, of all annotations of type type, to eliminate trailing whitespace.

      • shrinkAll

        public void shrinkAll()
        shrink the endpoint, using shrink, of all annotations in the document.

      • skipWhitespace

        public int skipWhitespace(int posn,
                          int end)
        Advance a character pointer past any whitespace.
        Parameters:
        posn - A character offset within the document text.
        end - An upper bound on the final value of the offset.
        Returns:
        The offset of the first non-whitespace character following posn.

      • annotationWithID

        public Annotation annotationWithID(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the annotation with a given ID.
